### Ingest
#### border graph

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

df_path <- "archetypes/human-disease-network/human-disease-network-edges.csv"
df <- read.csv(df_path, header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

head(df)

```


### Wrangle
#### Format the data into a graph data frame 


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide'}

df_filter <- filter(df, DISORDER_TYPE == 'Cancer')

# Convert data to graph data frame
# directed FALSE means no flow. It's just an association
df_graph <- graph.data.frame(df, directed = FALSE)
df_graph

```

### Plot
#### nicely


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source='fold-hide', fig.align='center', out.width="100%"}

theme_opts <- theme(
    text = element_text(family = "inconsolata"), 
    # plot.margin = unit(c(1.5,1,1,1), "in"),
    legend.position='top'
)

v1 <- ggraph(layout) + 
  geom_edge_diagonal(aes(colour = factor(DISORDER_TYPE)), alpha = 0.6) +
  geom_node_point(size = 1, alpha = 0.6) +
  theme_graph()+
  theme_opts

girafe(ggobj = v1, width_svg = 16, height_svg = 14,
       options = list(opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE, width = 1.0))
)


```
